Detailed Description

Interactive lisp interpreter.

Definition in file main.c.

Function Documentation

int main ( int  argc,
char *  argv[] 
)

Interactive lisp read-eval-print loop.

To exit the interpreter, type "(quit)".

Example session (taken from TRoL): 

 > (quote a)
 a
 > (quote (a b c))
 (a b c)
 > (atom 'a)
 t
 > (atom '(a b c))
 nil
 > (atom '())
 t
 > (atom (atom 'a))
 t
 > (atom '(atom 'a))
 nil
 > (eq 'a 'a)
 t
 > (eq 'a 'b)
 nil
 > (eq '() '())
 t
 > (car '(a b c))
 a
 > (cdr '(a b c))
 (b c)
 > (cons 'a '(b c))
 (a b c)
 > (cons 'a (cons 'b (cons 'c '())))
 (a b c)
 > (car (cons 'a '(b c)))
 a
 > (cdr (cons 'a '(b c)))
 (b c)
 > (cond ((eq 'a 'b) 'first) ((atom 'a) 'second))
 second
 > ((lambda (x) (cons x '(b))) 'a)
 (a b)
 > ((lambda (x y) (cons x (cdr y))) 'z '(a b c))
 (z b c)
 > ((lambda (f) (f '(b c))) '(lambda (x) (cons 'a x)))
 (a b c)
 > ((label subst (lambda (x y z) (cond ((atom z) (cond ((eq z y) x) ('t z))) ('t (cons (subst x y (car z)) (subst x y (cdr z))))))) 'm 'b '(a b (a b c) d))
 (a m (a m c) d)
 > (quit)
 $

Lisp may also be read from a file, for example:

 ./lisp < ../test/sample.lisp

Parameters:
argc Argument count.
argv Vector of argument strings.
Returns:
Process error code.
See also:
parse(), eval(), print_list_notation()
